#Tutorial for building a simple Hello World Flex application with flex-mojos
= Introduction =

This is a simple tutorial for building your first Hello World Flex application using just flex-mojos and Maven.

First you need to [http://maven.apache.org/download.html install Maven]. The recommended version is 2.0.9. Make sure to follow the Installation Instructions at the bottom of the download page. You will also need Java 1.5 or newer.

Confirm that Maven is working properly by typing this at a command line:
{{{
mvn -v
}}}
You should see something similar to this:
{{{
$ mvn -v
Maven version: 2.0.9
Java version: 1.5.0_13
OS name: "mac os x" version: "10.5.4" arch: "i386" Family: "unix"
}}}
The Java version needs to be 1.5 or greater, and the OS might be different for you.

Now, lets create the project:

= Default file structure =
Create a new directory for your project that looks like this:

{{{
simpleapp
|-- pom.xml
|-- src
     |-- main
           |-- flex
                 |-- Main.mxml
}}}

Your pom.xml should look like:

{{{
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

	<parent>
		<groupId>info.rvin.mojo</groupId>
		<artifactId>flex-super-pom</artifactId>
		<version>1.0</version>
	</parent>

	<groupId>com.example.flex</groupId>
	<artifactId>simple-flex-application</artifactId>
	<version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<name>Simple Flex Application</name>

	<packaging>swf</packaging>

	<repositories>
		<repository>
			<id>flex-mojos-repository</id>
			<url>http://svn.sonatype.org/flexmojos/repository/</url>
			<releases><enabled>true</enabled></releases>
			<snapshots><enabled>false</enabled></snapshots>
		</repository>
	</repositories>
	
</project>
}}}

Now, lets create the Flex application Main.mxml file like this:
= Main.mxml =
{{{
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<mx:Application xmlns:mx="http://www.adobe.com/2006/mxml" layout="absolute">
	<mx:Text text="Hello flex-mojos!"/>
</mx:Application>
}}}

= Run Maven =

Now, lets build our project with Maven and flex-mojos. At the command line, type:
{{{
mvn install
}}}
If this is the first time you have run Maven, it will download a lot of files for a minute or two. You can ignore any warnings that look like this: `[WARNING] *** CHECKSUM FAILED`. At the end, you should see:
{{{
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESSFUL
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}}}

There should now be a directory named target in your simpleapp directory, and inside is your compiled Flex application: target/simple-flex-application-1.0-SNAPSHOT.swf . You can now run that application by double-clicking the simple-flex-application-1.0-SNAPSHOT.swf inside your target directory.

*Congratulations, you have built your first Flex application with flex-mojos!*
